authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ [1911 C&P ï¿½ 30; RL ï¿½ 6295; NCL ï¿½ 9979]

section.heading: Construction of provisions similar to existing laws.

content.p: The provisions of this title, insofar as they are substantially the same as existing statutes, shall be construed as continuations thereof and not as new enactments.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ [1911 C&P ï¿½ 36; RL ï¿½ 6301; NCL ï¿½ 9985]

section.heading: Effect of provisions upon past offenses.

content.p: Nothing contained in any provision of this title shall apply to an offense committed or act done at any time before the day when this title shall take effect. Such an offense shall be punished according to, and such act shall be governed by, the provisions of law existing when it is done or committed, in the same manner as if this title had not been passed.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ [1911 C&P ï¿½ 31; RL ï¿½ 6296; NCL ï¿½ 9980]

content.p: Nothing in this title shall be deemed to affect any civil right or remedy existing at the time when it shall take effect by virtue of the common law or of the provision of any statute.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ [1911 C&P ï¿½ 32; RL ï¿½ 6297; NCL ï¿½ 9981]

content.p: The omission to specify or affirm in this title any liability to any damages, penalty, forfeiture or other remedy imposed by law, and allowed to be recovered or enforced in any civil action or proceeding, for any act or omission declared punishable in this title shall not affect any right to recover or enforce the same.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ [1911 C&P ï¿½ 37; RL ï¿½ 6302; NCL ï¿½ 9986]

section.heading: Authority of courts-martial unaffected; punishment for contempt unaffected.

content.p: This title does not affect any power conferred by law upon any court-martial, or other military authority, or officer, to impose or inflict punishment upon offenders; nor any power conferred by law upon any public body, tribunal or officer, to impose or inflict punishment for a contempt.

section.heading: Contracts with private entities to perform certain core correctional services; annual report concerning prisoners housed outside this State; inspection of facility of private entity that houses prisoners.

content.p: Expired by limitation. (See chapter 178,Statutes of Nevada 2019, at page 955.)

section.heading: Prisons to be under control of State or local government.

content.p: Each prison that houses prisoners who are in the custody of the State or a local government must be under the administrative and direct operational control of the State or the local government, as applicable. The core correctional services at each such prison must be performed only by employees of the State or a local government, as applicable, and not by a private entity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A condition, stipulation or provision in a contract that conflicts with this section is against the public policy of this State and is void and unenforceable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½core correctional servicesï¿½ means the housing, safeguarding, protecting and disciplining of prisoners.
